_**Jackass Number Two**_ is a 2006 American [reality](/wiki/Reality_film
"Reality film") [comedy film](/wiki/Comedy_film "Comedy film"). It is the
sequel to _[Jackass: The Movie](/wiki/Jackass:_The_Movie "Jackass: The
Movie")_ (2002), both based upon the [MTV](/wiki/MTV "MTV") series
_[Jackass](/wiki/Jackass_\(TV_series\) "Jackass \(TV series\)")_. Like its
predecessor and the original TV show, the film is a compilation of stunts,
pranks and skits. The film stars the regular _Jackass_ cast of [Johnny
Knoxville](/wiki/Johnny_Knoxville "Johnny Knoxville"), [Bam
Margera](/wiki/Bam_Margera "Bam Margera"), [Chris Pontius](/wiki/Chris_Pontius
"Chris Pontius"), [Steve-O](/wiki/Steve-O "Steve-O"), [Ryan
Dunn](/wiki/Ryan_Dunn "Ryan Dunn"), [Dave England](/wiki/Dave_England "Dave
England"), [Jason "Wee Man" Acuña](/wiki/Jason_Acu%C3%B1a "Jason Acuña"),
[Ehren McGhehey](/wiki/Ehren_McGhehey "Ehren McGhehey"), and [Preston
Lacy](/wiki/Preston_Lacy "Preston Lacy"). Everyone depicted in the film plays
as themselves. All nine main cast members from the first film returned for the
sequel. The film was directed by [Jeff Tremaine](/wiki/Jeff_Tremaine "Jeff
Tremaine"), who also directed _[Jackass: The Movie](/wiki/Jackass:_The_Movie
"Jackass: The Movie")_ and produced _[Jackass](/wiki/Jackass_\(TV_series\)
"Jackass \(TV series\)")_.

The film was produced by [Dickhouse Productions](/wiki/Dickhouse_Productions
"Dickhouse Productions") and Lynch Siderow Productions and distributed by [MTV
Films](/wiki/MTV_Films "MTV Films") and [Paramount
Pictures](/wiki/Paramount_Pictures "Paramount Pictures"). The film premiered
in theatres on September 22, 2006. The DVD was later released on December 26,
2006. _Jackass 2.5_ , a [direct-to-video](/wiki/Direct-to-video "Direct-to-
video") feature, was made available online on December 19, 2007 and on DVD on
December 26, 2007.[2] It contains most of the deleted and unused scenes that
were originally shot for _Jackass Number Two_. The film grossed nearly $85
million worldwide against a production budget of $11.5 million.

## Summary[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Summary")]

_Jackass Number Two_ is a compilation of various stunts, pranks and skits. The
film opens with an introduction of the primary cast members as they are being
chased by bulls in a suburban neighborhood.

List of stunts:

  1. Puppet Show – Chris Pontius's [penis](/wiki/Penis "Penis") is placed in a puppet in order to entice a snake to bite it.
  2. The Valentine – Members of the team are lured over to a valentine note on a hotel wall supposedly left by a fan, which hides a spring-loaded boxing glove.
  3. Firehose Rodeo – Dave England rides a spraying [fire hose](/wiki/Fire_hose "Fire hose") in a mud pit.
  4. Bicentennial Bmxing – Johnny Knoxville and Ryan Dunn attempt to use [Penny-farthing](/wiki/Penny-farthing "Penny-farthing") bicycles to perform modern bike stunts.
  5. The Strongman – Johnny Knoxville and Bam Margera try to put a [dildo](/wiki/Dildo "Dildo") up Margera's butt using a barbell
  6. [Spike Jonze](/wiki/Spike_Jonze "Spike Jonze") dresses as an old lady pranking strangers in public.
  7. The Mini-Loop – Danger Ehren McGhehey attempts to use a [Minibike](/wiki/Minibike "Minibike") on a miniature [loop-the-loop](/wiki/Loop-the-loop "Loop-the-loop").
  8. The Brand – Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, and Ryan Dunn [brand](/wiki/Livestock_branding "Livestock branding") the outline of a penis on Margera's ass. Later, Margera shows the results of the brand to his parents.
  9. Lake Jump – Johnny Knoxville and Chris Pontius attempt to ride a rocket-powered bicycle over a lake. [Mark Zupan](/wiki/Mark_Zupan_\(athlete\) "Mark Zupan \(athlete\)") and [Mat Hoffman](/wiki/Mat_Hoffman "Mat Hoffman") also attempt the stunt, Zupan in a modified wheelchair.
  10. The Fish Hook – Steve-O pierces his cheek with a [fish hook](/wiki/Fish_hook "Fish hook") and dives in shark-infested waters.
  11. The Electric Stool – Bam Margera, Steve-O, and Chris Pontius have Wee-Man sit on an electrified stool while Jim Karol attempts to throw cards into Wee-Man's butt crack.
  12. Dramatic Re-Enactment- Bam Margera recreates the results of a stunt gone wrong with a drawing.
  13. The Bungee Jump – Wee Man and Preston Lacy are linked together for a [bungee jump](/wiki/Bungee_jump "Bungee jump") off a bridge.
  14. Bad Grandpa – Johnny Knoxville plays a grandpa named Irving Zisman, visiting a [food truck](/wiki/Food_truck "Food truck") with his "grandson," intentionally provoking customers to fight him over his offensive comments and irresponsible behavior.
  15. The Beehive Limo – Ryan Dunn, Steve-O, Wee Man, Dave England get inside a limo, then Johnny Knoxville and Bam Margera dump bees inside of it.
  16. The Rake Jump – Steve-O Jumps on the end of a rake, hitting himself in the face with the handle.
  17. Riot Control Test – Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, and Ryan Dunn get shot with [riot control rubber balls](/wiki/M5_crowd_control_munition "M5 crowd control munition").
  18. Medicine Ball Dodgeball – Bam Margera and the team play [dodgeball](/wiki/Dodgeball "Dodgeball") in the dark with [medicine balls](/wiki/Medicine_ball "Medicine ball").
  19. The Magic Trick – [John Waters](/wiki/John_Waters "John Waters") and Wee-Man perform a sketch in which Wee-Man "disappears."
  20. The Gauntlet – Johnny Knoxville, Dave England, and Bam Margera attempt to ride across a [skate ramp](/wiki/Skate_ramp "Skate ramp") lined with swinging sandbags thrown by [Mat Hoffman](/wiki/Mat_Hoffman "Mat Hoffman") and [Tony Hawk](/wiki/Tony_Hawk "Tony Hawk")
  21. The Toro Totter – Johnny Knoxville, Chris Pontius, Bam Margera, and Ryan Dunn sit on seesaws in the center of a rodeo ring while a bull attempts to gore them.
  22. Butt Chug – Steve-O attempts to chug beer using a tube up his butt.
  23. The Rocket Cart – Ryan Dunn rides a rocket-powered shopping cart off a ramp into the water.
  24. The Anaconda Ball Pit – Johnny Knoxville, Wee Man, and Ryan Dunn get in a [ball pit](/wiki/Ball_pit "Ball pit") with an anaconda.
  25. The Ice Horse – Ryan Dunn sits on a horse figurine made out of ice with no underwear on, in the hopes that his [balls](/wiki/Testicles "Testicles") will stick to the ice.
  26. The Swamp Chute – In a swamp area, Wee-Man deploys a parachute in front of a high-powered fan.
  27. How to Milk a Horse – Johnny Knoxville and Chris Pontius [masturbate](/wiki/Masturbation "Masturbation") a horse, and Pontius drinks the [ejaculate](/wiki/Semen "Semen").
  28. The Big Tire Race – The guys ride down a hill inside giant tires.
  29. The Leech Healer – In India, Dave England and Steve-O apply leeches to themselves.
  30. Wind Tunnel – Bam Margera is tricked into doing a stunt that is actually a prank involving his [fear of snakes](/wiki/Fear_of_snakes "Fear of snakes").
  31. The Fart Mask – Steve-O puts on a helmet connected to a tube that Preston Lacy farts into.
  32. Big Green Ball – Dave England attempts to ride a big green ball.
  33. Old Man Balls – Johnny Knoxville, as Irving Zisman, dangles a fake pair of testicles down the leg of his shorts and approaches pedestrians.
  34. The Switcheroo – Bam Margera pranks his mother, April, by having his father, Phil, slip out of bed in the middle of the night, and sends Preston Lacy dressed as Phil in as a replacement.
  35. Big Red Rocket – Johnny Knoxville prepares to ride a gigantic rocket.
  36. Terror Taxi – Danger Ehren is lured into a prank where he thinks he is pranking a random cab driver by posing as a terrorist, but the rest of the gang is pranking him by having [Jay Chandrasekhar](/wiki/Jay_Chandrasekhar "Jay Chandrasekhar") play a driver who retaliates against the "terrorists." The gang also convinces Ehren to wear a fake beard made out of the group's [pubic hair](/wiki/Pubic_hair "Pubic hair").
  37. The Bear Trap – Johnny Knoxville puts his hand into a [bear trap](/wiki/Trapping "Trapping")

The movie finishes with a [Busby Berkeley-style](/wiki/Busby_Berkeley "Busby
Berkeley") movie musical production number set to the _[La Cage aux
Folles](/wiki/La_Cage_aux_Folles_\(musical\) "La Cage aux Folles
\(musical\)")_ song "The Best of Times", where the guys sing and dance while
performing more stunts.  

## Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Cast")]

The entire main cast from _[Jackass: The Movie](/wiki/Jackass:_The_Movie
"Jackass: The Movie")_ returned for the sequel.

  * [Johnny Knoxville](/wiki/Johnny_Knoxville "Johnny Knoxville")
  * [Bam Margera](/wiki/Bam_Margera "Bam Margera")
  * [Chris Pontius](/wiki/Chris_Pontius "Chris Pontius")
  * [Steve-O](/wiki/Steve-O "Steve-O")
  * [Ryan Dunn](/wiki/Ryan_Dunn "Ryan Dunn")
  * [Dave England](/wiki/Dave_England "Dave England")
  * [Jason "Wee-Man" Acuña](/wiki/Jason_Acu%C3%B1a "Jason Acuña")
  * [Danger Ehren](/wiki/Danger_Ehren "Danger Ehren")
  * [Preston Lacy](/wiki/Preston_Lacy "Preston Lacy")

The film also includes guest appearances by [Brandon
Novak](/wiki/Brandon_Novak "Brandon Novak"), [Mark
Zupan](/wiki/Mark_Zupan_\(sportsman\) "Mark Zupan \(sportsman\)"), [Brandon
DiCamillo](/wiki/Brandon_DiCamillo "Brandon DiCamillo"), [Roger Alan
Wade](/wiki/Roger_Alan_Wade "Roger Alan Wade"), [Dimitry
Elyashkevich](/wiki/Dimitry_Elyashkevich "Dimitry Elyashkevich"), [Loomis
Fall](/wiki/Loomis_Fall "Loomis Fall"), [Lance Bangs](/wiki/Lance_Bangs "Lance
Bangs"), animal experts David Weathers and [Manny Puig](/wiki/Manny_Puig
"Manny Puig"), [Rick Kosick](/wiki/Rick_Kosick "Rick Kosick"), [Spike
Jonze](/wiki/Spike_Jonze "Spike Jonze") and [cult film](/wiki/Cult_film "Cult
film") directors [John Waters](/wiki/John_Waters_\(filmmaker\) "John Waters
\(filmmaker\)"), [Jay Chandrasekhar](/wiki/Jay_Chandrasekhar "Jay
Chandrasekhar"). Professional [BMX](/wiki/BMX "BMX") rider [Mat
Hoffman](/wiki/Mat_Hoffman "Mat Hoffman") and professional skater [Tony
Hawk](/wiki/Tony_Hawk "Tony Hawk") participated in stunts. Rap group [Three 6
Mafia](/wiki/Three_6_Mafia "Three 6 Mafia") also appears, as well as
[HIM](/wiki/HIM_\(Finnish_band\) "HIM \(Finnish band\)") singer [Ville
Valo](/wiki/Ville_Valo "Ville Valo") and NFL star [Jason
Taylor](/wiki/Jason_Taylor_\(American_football_player\) "Jason Taylor
\(American football player\)"). [Mike Judge](/wiki/Mike_Judge "Mike Judge"),
[Luke Wilson](/wiki/Luke_Wilson "Luke Wilson") and [Willie
Garson](/wiki/Willie_Garson "Willie Garson") are featured in the credits and
in deleted scenes.

Stunts including _Jackass_ and _[Viva La Bam](/wiki/Viva_La_Bam "Viva La
Bam")_ regular [Don Vito](/wiki/Vincent_Margera "Vincent Margera") were also
filmed and shown in previews. However, due to the scandal surrounding his
arrest just prior to the film's release and the nature of the charges against
him, all the scenes involving Don Vito were cut.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Production")]

Shooting began on January 30, 2006, and ended on June 23, 2006.[3][4] The
_Jackass_ cast refused to divulge where they were filming, out of fear of fans
interfering with the filming process. However, they have filmed in
[India](/wiki/India "India"), [Australia](/wiki/Australia "Australia"),
[England](/wiki/England "England"), [Moscow](/wiki/Moscow,_Russia "Moscow,
Russia") and [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina "Argentina"). A few insights were
leaked prior to the movie's release by [Steve-O](/wiki/Steve-O "Steve-O") and
[Bam Margera](/wiki/Bam_Margera "Bam Margera") via [Radio Bam](/wiki/Radio_Bam
"Radio Bam") and [Loveline](/wiki/Loveline "Loveline"). Other shootings were
[Bull Shoals, Arkansas](/wiki/Bull_Shoals,_Arkansas "Bull Shoals, Arkansas");
[Key West, Florida](/wiki/Key_West,_Florida "Key West, Florida"); [Los
Angeles, California](/wiki/Los_Angeles,_California "Los Angeles, California");
[Miami, Florida](/wiki/Miami,_Florida "Miami, Florida"); [New Orleans,
Louisiana](/wiki/New_Orleans,_Louisiana "New Orleans, Louisiana"); [New York
City, New York](/wiki/New_York_City,_New_York "New York City, New York"); and
[West Chester, Pennsylvania](/wiki/West_Chester,_Pennsylvania "West Chester,
Pennsylvania").

The stunt "How to Milk a Horse" was originally shot for
_[Wildboyz](/wiki/Wildboyz "Wildboyz")_ , but was saved for future use.[5]
"The idea to drink the horse semen was not actually planned but was "in the
back of everyone's mind."[6] To agree to do the stunt, [Chris
Pontius](/wiki/Chris_Pontius "Chris Pontius") asked director Jeff Tremaine for
a full day off of work, but discouraged doing so since Pontius had missed work
the day before.[7] Additionally on screen Chris Pontius stated to Jeff
Tremaine "This is going to make up for something bad I'm going to do in the
future." This deal was verbally agreed upon and sealed with a handshake; it
was also noted that said deal was videotaped for the camera.

## Screenings and
release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Screenings and release")]

The film had 4 different screenings for fans of Jackass and
[MySpace](/wiki/MySpace "MySpace") users, which was a part of MySpace's "Black
Carpet" screening. The screenings took place a few days before the movie was
released (possibly August). Some of the screenings also had surprise visits by
cast and crew. For example, the Pennsylvania screening had director Jeff
Tremaine and cast members Johnny Knoxville and Bam Margera.

On June 15, 2006, [Yahoo!](/wiki/Yahoo! "Yahoo!") released the first official
teaser for the movie.[8] The stunts in the trailer included Knoxville riding a
"rocket bike" off a ramp and a blindfolded Knoxville being rammed by a
[yak](/wiki/Yak "Yak").

The film was released on DVD on October 10, 2006 in its R-rated version in
[full](/wiki/4:3 "4:3") and [widescreen](/wiki/Widescreen "Widescreen"), and
in widescreen in the unrated version.[9]

### Box
office[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Box office")]

_Jackass Number Two_ opened on September 22, 2006, in 3,900 screens at 3,059
theaters. It debuted at number one on its opening weekend with a total gross
of $29 million, making $5 or 6 million more than expected by
[Paramount](/wiki/Paramount_Pictures "Paramount Pictures") executives.[10] On
its first day in theaters _Jackass Number Two_ matched its $11.5 million
production budget.[10] The film grossed an additional $14 million in its
second week. Overall the film made $84.2 million worldwide, nearly $10 million
more than the original.

## Critical
reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Critical reception")]

On [Rotten Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"), it has a 63%
approval rating from 102 listed critics; the average rating is 5.8/10. The
general consensus reads: "Better than any sequel to the movie of a television
show has a right to be, _Jackass Number Two_ dares you not to laugh."[11] On
[Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic "Metacritic"), the film has a rating of 66 out
of 100 based on 23 reviews, which indicates "generally favorable reviews".[12]
_[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times "The New York Times")_ awarded
_Jackass Number Two_ a Critic's Pick, writing, "Debased, infantile and
reckless in the extreme, this compendium of body bravado and malfunction makes
for some of the most fearless, liberated and cathartic comedy in modern
movies."[13] On _[Ebert& Roeper](/wiki/At_the_Movies_with_Ebert_%26_Roeper "At
the Movies with Ebert & Roeper")_, [Richard Roeper](/wiki/Richard_Roeper
"Richard Roeper") and guest critic [Fred Willard](/wiki/Fred_Willard "Fred
Willard") gave _Jackass Number Two_ a "Two Thumbs Up" rating.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

##
Soundtrack[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Soundtrack")]

Main article: [Jackass Number Two: Music from the Motion
Picture](/wiki/Jackass_Number_Two:_Music_from_the_Motion_Picture "Jackass
Number Two: Music from the Motion Picture")

The soundtrack was released on September 26, 2006 by Bulletproof Records. The
soundtrack features songs that were featured in the movie, and various audio
clips from the movie. Among the new songs included in the soundtrack are
"Gettin' Fucked Up" – a collaboration between rap group [Three Six
Mafia](/wiki/Three_Six_Mafia "Three Six Mafia") and [Josey
Scott](/wiki/Josey_Scott "Josey Scott"), lead singer of [heavy
metal](/wiki/Heavy_metal_music "Heavy metal music") band
[Saliva](/wiki/Saliva_\(band\) "Saliva \(band\)") – and "Backass" – a
collaboration between [electroclash](/wiki/Electroclash "Electroclash")
musician [Peaches](/wiki/Peaches_\(musician\) "Peaches \(musician\)") and
[Karen O](/wiki/Karen_O "Karen O"), lead singer of the [indie
rock](/wiki/Indie_rock "Indie rock") trio [Yeah Yeah
Yeahs](/wiki/Yeah_Yeah_Yeahs "Yeah Yeah Yeahs").

## DVD
release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: DVD release")]

The Rated and Unrated DVD versions of the movie were released on December 26,
2006.[9] The rated version includes the 96 minute theatrical release, with
bonus features, and the unrated includes extended scenes that were shortened
in the original movie. Both DVDs feature commentary by the cast (except [Bam
Margera](/wiki/Bam_Margera "Bam Margera")), director [Jeff
Tremaine](/wiki/Jeff_Tremaine "Jeff Tremaine") and cinematographer [Dimitry
Elyashkevich](/wiki/Dimitry_Elyashkevich "Dimitry Elyashkevich"). The DVD also
included 16 deleted scenes removed from the theatrical release, more than 20
additional scenes, 9 TV spots, 8 promotional spots including trailer, gag
reel, the uncensored version of _Karazy_ by [Chris
Pontius](/wiki/Chris_Pontius "Chris Pontius") and a promotional commercial for
the 2006 [VMAs](/wiki/MTV_Video_Music_Awards "MTV Video Music Awards").[14]
_The Making of Jackass_ featurette is also featured on the DVD.

### _Jackass
2.5_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=9 "Edit
section: Jackass 2.5")]

_**Jackass 2.5**_ was a home media version with additional footage. It was
released to the Internet at [Blockbuster.com](/wiki/Blockbuster.com
"Blockbuster.com") and [Hulu](/wiki/Hulu "Hulu") as a free screening on
December 19–31, 2007, and to DVD on December 26, 2007. It includes special
features such as: the making of _Jackass 2.5_ , the making of _[Jackass: The
Game](/wiki/Jackass:_The_Game "Jackass: The Game")_ , deleted scenes, photo
gallery, and additional _Terror Taxi_ footage.[15][16]

Added stunts include:

  1. Beauty and the Beast – Preston Lacy and Wee Man recreate the King Kong movie where Lacy painted as King Kong and Wee Man dressed as the damsel in distress and the guys are controlling a toy airplane afterwards Lacy falls off of the port o potty and rolls down a hill. The next day Lacy and Wee-Man retry the stunt again but this time Lacy crushes the planes but soon afterwards Lacy falls of the port o potty and rolls down a hill.
  2. Phil Margera is trying to eat a meatball but with help from Bam Margera he slingshots the meatball in his father's eye.
  3. Dizzy Boxing – Dave England and Ehren McGhehey try to box while kneeling of chairs but after they get dizzy England and McGhehey start boxing with Preston Lacy as the Referee and Chris Pontius as England's manager after three rounds of the match McGhehey wins by knockout.
  4. Butt bead ass Kite – Bam Margera puts anal beads tied to a kite up his anus and attempts to fly the kite with the anal beads at the beach.
  5. El Matador – Wee Man becomes a matador and attempts to lure a baby bull towards a red kite.
  6. Bam Margera and Ryan Dunn scare April with a fake bazooka.
  7. Preston Lacy knocks over a Porta Potty with Bam Margera inside.
  8. Johnny Knoxville pranks the guys by putting a clamp with a fake crab on their arms.
  9. Wee-Man scares Ryan Dunn by squiring urine on him with a water gun.
  10. Human Golf Tee – Johnny Knoxville and Bam Margera attempt to hit a golf ball golf off of Ryan Dunn's anus. Later, a man attempts to hit a golf ball off of Bam Margera's zipper.
  11. Wee-Man and Chris Pontius stand at the golf course getting hit by golf balls.
  12. Johnny Knoxville sees a doctor to check his prostate. Afterwards, Knoxville urinates in a cup and throws it at Rick Kosick.
  13. Rattlesnack Salad Toss – Steve-O gets a rattlesnack to bite a balloon taped to his anus.
  14. Chris Pontius gets bit on the nose by an [Alligator Snapping Turtle](/wiki/Alligator_Snapping_Turtle "Alligator Snapping Turtle").
  15. [Shridhar Chillal](/wiki/Shridhar_Chillal "Shridhar Chillal") pours beer on his long fingernails while Steve-O drinks the runoff underneath; afterwards, Steve-O throws up and disgusts some women who watched the act.
  16. Danger Ehren attempts to sit on a bed of nails with a cobra on top of him while the snake charmers play the flute.
  17. Preston Lacy gets shot with an [ALS](/wiki/Riot_gun "Riot gun") on his ass; three hours later, Lacy gets a bruise.
  18. Cajun Obstacle Course – The guys, dressed as prison inmates, ride skateboards into mud, crawl under barbed wire in mud with crocodiles, run with a high power fan, run through a chute with pigs, get shot with paintballs by professional paint ballers, and attempt to take shots of tobacco spit cups. Bam wins the obstacle course.
  19. The Test Drive – Irving Zisman is at a car dealership getting a test drive while [Clyde Singleton](/w/index.php?title=Clyde_Singleton&action=edit&redlink=1 "Clyde Singleton \(page does not exist\)") tries to screw up the test drive and argues with the dealer while Zisman runs away afterwards.
  20. The Deconstruction Site – Zisman is a at construction site and tries to fight with the workers.
  21. Bam Margera attempts to urinate in a cup and gets it thrown onto his face in front of his mother.
  22. Mini Motorcyle Mayham – The guys along with [Mat Hoffman](/wiki/Mat_Hoffman "Mat Hoffman") attempts to ride mini motorcycles at a supermarket and destroy stocks of food riding around the whole store.
  23. The Poof – Johnny Knoxville puts baby powder on Wee-Man's anus while he tries to fart.
  24. The Butt Bellows – The guys along with [Mike Judge](/wiki/Mike_Judge "Mike Judge") pull blades of grass to see who has the shortest. The loser, Lacy, has the guys use [bellows](/wiki/Bellows "Bellows") up his anus to try and make him fart.

## Sequel[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jackass_Number_Two&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Sequel")]

Main article: [Jackass 3D](/wiki/Jackass_3D "Jackass 3D")

Paramount Pictures and MTV Films greenlit a third _Jackass_ , which was shot
in 3D.[17] Filming began in January 2010 and it was released on October 15,
2010.[18]
